requestBody.description:
VIRTUAL device model.
**NOTE:** Parameter `id` is ignored. (Read-only)
**NOTE:** Parameter `type` is required.
**NOTE:** Since keys are optional (excluding these mentioned in notes), missing values will be set to default.
**NOTE:** Adding **Gate** requires `variant` to be set to one of following values: `sliding_gate`, `swing_gate` or `garage_gate`!
**NOTE:** When adding **CustomDevice** you can choose type of custom device by setting `variant` to one of following values: `generic`, `temperature_sensor`, `heat_pump`, `inverter`, `energy_meter`, `battery`, `common_dhw_main`.

get.summary: Wildcard GET request path to lua http server.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: User custom url path.

get.description:
This is wildcard route
**NOTE:** Wildcard ({path} in path) means that everything what comes into {path} place is forwarded as url path to your automation script.
**NOTE:** The `/lua/http-server` (`/api/v1/lua/http-server`) url prefix will be removed. eg. when you request `/api/v1/lua/http-server/my-endpoint/5` will get forwarded as `/my-endpoint/5` url. You can catch `5` as parameter (eg. named `id`) if you declared in script.
**NOTE:** Successful response depends on users`s lua script (automation) thus its not documented here, see lua documentation for http-server.

DeviceCommand.Common.Any.EnqueueAction.description:
Command: `enqueue_action`.
Schedules the action to execute for device after a period of time.
Body is required.

type.description: Type of action to execute. Parameter change or command.

param_or_command.description: Name of parameter that will be changed or command that will be executed.

argument.description: Value that will be set in the parameter when action type is `parameter` or argument to execute command when action type is `command`. Type varies depending on the parameter or command.

after.description: Time in milliseconds after which the action should be executed.

DeviceCommand.Common.Any.CancelAction.description:
Command: `cancel_action`.
Cancels the scheduled action of a device.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.Any.ClearActions.description:
Command: `clear_actions`.
Remove all scheduled actions for the device.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Relay.TurnOn.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls Relay to turn on output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Relay.TurnOff.description:
Command: `turn_off`.
Calls Relay to turn off output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Relay.Toggle.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls Relay to toggle output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.TemperatureRegulato.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls Temperature to change `constant` or `time_limited` mode target temperature to the desired value. If regulator works in `time_limited` mode it will change target temperature only, not affecting `remaining_time`. If regulator works in `schedule` mode it will change target temperature mode to `constant`.
Body is required.

Command: `enable_constant_mode`.
Calls Temperature Regulator to change target temperature mode to `constant`. When regulator is already in `constant` mode, it will change mode `target_temperature` only.
Body is required.
NOTE: Cannot be executed when regulator is not associated with Thermostat.

Command: `enable_time_limited_mode`.
Calls Temperature Regulator to change mode and target temperature mode to `time_limited` for desired time. When regulator is already in `time_limited` mode, it will change `remaining_time` or/and `target_temperature` depending on payload.
Body is required.
First parameter is `remaining_time`, second is `target_temperature`.
NOTE: Cannot be executed when regulator is not associated with Thermostat.

enable_constant_mode.description: Two element array with Time in minutes (first element) and Target temperature in Celsius degrees (second element).

DeviceCommand.Common.TemperatureRegulato.description:
Command: `disable_time_limited_mode`.
Calls Temperature Regulator to disable `time_limited` and go back to previous target temperature mode. When regulator is not in `time_limited` mode, it will do nothing.
Body is ignored.
NOTE: Cannot be executed when regulator is not associated with Thermostat.

DeviceCommand.Common.Dimmer.TurnOn.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls Dimmer to turn on output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Dimmer.TurnOff.description:
Command: `turn_off`.
Calls Dimmer to turn off output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Dimmer.Toggle.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls Dimmer to toggle output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Dimmer.SetLevel.description:
Command: `set_level`.
Calls Dimmer to set light intensity to requested level during requested period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `requested_level`, Unit: %, min: 0, max: 100.
Second parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Second parameter is optional, default: 5.

set_level.description: Two element array with Requested level (first element) and Transition time in 0.1 of seconds (second element).

DeviceCommand.Common.Dimmer.Stop.description:
Command: `stop`.
Calls Dimmer to stop current level moving action. Does nothing if no action is in progress.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.TurnO.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls RGBController to turn on output.
Body is optional.
Parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Default: 5 when not provided.

Command: `turn_off`.
Calls RGBController to turn off output.
Body is optional.
Parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Default: 5 when not provided.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.Toggl.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls RGBController to toggle output.
Body is optional.
Parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Default: 5 when not provided.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.SetLe.description:
Command: `set_brightness`.
Calls RGBController to set light intensity to requested level during requested period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `brightness_level`, Unit: %, min: 1, max: 100.
Second parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Second parameter is optional, default: 5.

set_brightness.description: Two element array with Brightness level (first element) and Transition time in 0.1 of seconds (second element).

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.SetCo.description:
Command: `set_color`.
Calls RGBController to set output to requested color in RGB mode during requested period of time. Set `color_mode` to `rgb`.
Body is required.
First parameter is HTML/Hex RGB representation `led_color`.
Second parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Second parameter is optional, default: 5.

set_color.description: Two element array with HTML/Hex RGB representation `led_color` (first element) and Transition time in 0.1 of seconds (second element).

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.SetTe.description:
Command: `set_temperature`.
Calls RGBController to set output to requested color temperature during requested period of time. Set `color_mode` to `temperature`.
Body is required.
First parameter is `white_temperature`, Unit: Kelvins, min: 1000, max: 40000.
Second parameter is `transition_time` , Unit: 0,1s, min: 1, max: 6000. Second parameter is optional, default: 5.

set_temperature.description: Two element array with `white_temperature` (first element) and Transition time in 0.1 of seconds (second element).

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.AddAn.description:
Command: `add_animation`.
Add user defined animation with specified animation style.
Body is required.
Number of steps must be equal to number of steps for specified animation style.

name.description: Name of animation.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.Updat.description:
Command: `update_animation`.
Update user animation with specified id.
Body is required.
id is required. When updating steps, number of steps must be equal to number of steps for specified animation style.

name.description: Name of animation.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.Activ.description:
Command: `activate_animation`.
Calls RGBController to activate specified user animation. Set `color_mode` to `animation`.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.StopA.description:
Command: `stop_animation`.
Calls RGBController to stop animation and return to previous `color_mode`.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.SetLi.description:
Command: `set_live_animation`.
Sends animation steps to RGB controller without changing anything in device representation. Turn on live editing mode, all changes from remote device will be discarded.
Body is required.
Number of steps must be equal to number of steps for specified animation style.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.StopL.description:
Command: `stop_live_editing`.
Turns off live editing mode, set RGB controller device to current `color_mode` e.g. rgb.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.RGBController.Stop.description:
Command: `stop`.
Calls RGBController to stop current moving action. Does nothing if no action is in progress.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.Button.Emit.description:
Command: `emit`.
Emits button action event by software.

button_index.description: index of the button that the action event concerns

duration.description: duration of the hold in seconds or amount of clicks, ignored if the type is `hold_start`

set.description: the current button set (channel) that the action applies to (changes `button_set.current`)

DeviceCommand.Common.MotionSensor.Enable.description:
Command: `enable`.
Calls Motion Sensor to enable motion detection.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.MotionSensor.Disabl.description:
Command: `disable`.
Calls Motion Sensor to disable motion detection.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.MotionSensor.AddTim.description:
Command: `add_time_since_motion_event`.
Add custom interval for time_since_motion notify to motion sensor.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.BlindController.Ope.description:
Command: `open`.
Calls Blind Controller to open to the desired value.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.BlindController.Til.description:
Command: `tilt`.
Calls Blind Controller to tilt to the desired value.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.BlindController.Up.description:
Command: `up`.
Calls Blind Controller to fully open blinds.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.BlindController.Dow.description:
Command: `down`.
Calls Blind Controller to fully close blinds.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.BlindController.Sto.description:
Command: `stop`.
Calls Blind Controller to stop immediately at current position.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.BlindController.Cal.description:
Command: `calibration`.
Calls Blind Controller to start calibration cycle.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.AnalogOutput.SetVal.description:
Command: `set_value`.
Calls Analog output to set output value.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.PulseWidthModulatio.description:
Command: `set_frequency`.
Calls PWM to set output frequency.
Body is required.

Command: `set_duty_cycle`.
Calls PWM to set output duty cycle.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Common.EnergyMeter.ResetEn.description:
Command: `reset_energy_consumed`.
Calls Energy meter to reset energy consumed data.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Common.EnergyMeter.EnergyM.description:
Command: `calibration`.
Calls Energy meter to calibrate sensor, adjusting measurements to expected values.
Body is required.
First parameter is `expected voltage` in mV unit, second is `expected current` in mA unit, third is `expected active power` in mW unit.
NOTE: Calibration should be done using resistive load (or as close as possible to power factor [pF] = 1.0)!

calibration.description: Array of three values: expected voltage in mV unit, expected current in mA unit, expected active power in mW unit.

DeviceCommand.WTP.RadiatorActuator.Open.description:
Command: `open`.
Calls Radiator Actuator to open to the desired value.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.WTP.RadiatorActuator.Calib.description:
Command: `calibration`.
Calls Radiator Actuator to calibrate on next communication cycle.
Body is ignored.
NOTE: Cannot be executed when radiator actuator does not have `calibration_support` label!

DeviceCommand.WTP.SmokeSensor.Lock.description:
Command: `lock`.
Locks the sensor. Smoke detection and high temperature alarms will not be reported.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.SmokeSensor.Unlock.description:
Command: `unlock`.
Unlocks the sensor. Smoke detection and high temperature alarms will be reported if detected.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.Throttle.ReFactoryRese.description:
Command: `factory_reset`.
Calls Throttle to reset to factory settings.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.Throttle.Calibration.description:
Command: `calibration`.
Calls Throttle to start calibration cycle.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.FanControl.SetState.description:
Command `set_state`.
Sets current state of fan control device.
Body is required.
First parameter is the state.
Second parameter is duration the state should be on. Duration is forbidden for permament states (`off`, `automatic`, `holiday`) and optional for temporal states (`hurricane`, `party`, `hearth`, `flaccid`). When it is not passed default state duration is used.

set_state.description: Array of two values: state and duration.

DeviceCommand.WTP.IRHeater.TurnOn.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls IR heater to turn on output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.IRHeater.TurnOff.description:
Command: `turn_off`.
Calls IR heater to turn off output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.IRHeater.Toggle.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls IR heater to toggle output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.WTP.IRHeater.ResetAlarms.description:
Command: `reset_alarms`.
Calls IR heater to reset current alarms.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SBus.Subscribe.description:
Command `subscribe`.
Every SBus device can use this command. It sends subscribe requests to given device. Used in case device lost subscriptions for some reason.
Subscriptions are used to tell the device that it should notify central unit about any changes that are requested.

DeviceCommand.SBus.Valve.Calibration.description:
Command: `calibration`.
Calls valve to start calibration cycle.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SBus.FanCoil.TurnOn.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Send command to Fan coil device to turn on.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SBus.FanCoil.TurnOff.description:
Command: `turn_off`.
Send command to Fan coil device to turn off.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SBus.FanCoil.ForceBoostMod.description:
Command: `force_boost_mode`.
Send command to Fan coil device turn on boost mode.
Available only when `state` is `heating_demand` or `cooling_demand`.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.CoolingOn.description:
Command: `cooling_on_request`.
Calls Ventilation to send cooling on request.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.CoolingOf.description:
Command: `cooling_off_request`.
Calls Ventilation to send cooling off request.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.HeatingOn.description:
Command: `heating_on_request`.
Calls Ventilation to send heating on request.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.HeatingOf.description:
Command: `heating_off_request`.
Calls Ventilation to send heating off request.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.Humidifie.description:
Command: `humidifier_on_request`.
Calls Ventilation to send humidifier on request.
Body is ignored.

Command: `humidifier_off_request`.
Calls Ventilation to send humidifier off request.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.SetWorkMo.description:
Command: `set_work_mode`.
Calls Ventilation to change work mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: See `work_mode` property description.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.SetTarget.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls Ventilation to change target temperature.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.SetBypass.description:
Command: `set_bypass_work_mode`.
Calls Ventilation to change bypass work mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: See `bypass_work_mode_list` property description.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Ventilation.SetGwcWor.description:
Command: `set_gwc_work_mode`.
Calls Ventilation to change gwc work mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: See `gwc_work_mode_list` property description.

DeviceCommand.TECH.Buffer.SetTargetTempe.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls device to change target temperature.
Body is required.
NOTE: Can be used only if device is in `fixed` target temperature mode.

Command: `set_target_temperature_mode`.
Calls device to change target temperature mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: `fixed` / `heat_curve`.
NOTE: Can be used only if device has associated temperature curve.

DeviceCommand.TECH.MainDHW.SetTargetTemp.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls device to change target temperature.
Body is required.
NOTE: Can be used only if device is in `fixed` target temperature mode.

Command: `set_target_temperature_mode`.
Calls device to change target temperature mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: `fixed` / `heat_curve`.
NOTE: Can be used only if device has associated temperature curve.

DeviceCommand.TECH.PelletBoiler.SetTarge.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls device to change target temperature.
Body is required.
NOTE: Can be used only if device is in `fixed` target temperature mode.

Command: `set_target_temperature_mode`.
Calls device to change target temperature mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: `fixed` / `heat_curve`.
NOTE: Can be used only if device has associated temperature curve.

DeviceCommand.TECH.CommonValve.SetTarget.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls device to change target temperature.
Body is required.
NOTE: Can be used only if device is in `fixed` target temperature mode.

Command: `set_target_temperature_mode`.
Calls device to change target temperature mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: `fixed` / `heat_curve`.
NOTE: Can be used only if device has associated temperature curve.

DeviceCommand.TECH.CommonValve.SetWorkMo.description:
Command: `set_work_mode`.
Calls device to change work mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: See `work_mode` property description.

DeviceCommand.TECH.HeatPump.SetEHomeWork.description:
Command: `set_ehome_work_mode`.
Calls HeatPump to change ehome work mode (device climate mode).
Body is required.
Possible values: See `ehome_work_mode` property description.

DeviceCommand.TECH.HeatPump.SetWorkMode.description:
Command: `set_work_mode`.
Calls HeatPump to change work mode.
Body is required.
Possible values: One of `work_mode_list`. See `work_mode` and `work_mode_list` properties description.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Thermostat.SetTarg.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Calls Thermostat to change `constant` or `time_limited` mode target temperature to the desired value. If thermostat works in `time_limited` mode it will change target temperature only, not affecting `remaining_time`. If thermostat works in `schedule` mode it will change target temperature mode to `constant`.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Thermostat.EnableS.description:
Command: `enable_schedule_mode`.
Calls Thermostat to change mode and target temperature mode to `schedule`.
Body is ignored.
Cannot be called on Thermostat without `has_schedule` label.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Thermostat.EnableC.description:
Command: `enable_constant_mode`.
Calls Thermostat to change mode and target temperature mode to `constant`. When thermostat is already in `constant` mode, it will change mode `target_temperature` only.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Thermostat.EnableT.description:
Command: `enable_time_limited_mode`.
Calls Thermostat to change target temperature mode to `time_limited` for desired time. When thermostat is already in `time_limited` mode, it will change `remaining_time` or/and `target_temperature` depending on payload.
Body is required.
First parameter is `remaining_time`, second is `target_temperature`.

enable_time_limited_mode.description: Array of two values: remaining time and target temperature.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Thermostat.SetMode.description:
Command: `set_mode`.
Calls Thermostat to change mode to `heating`, `cooling` or `off`.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Thermostat.Disable.description:
Command: `disable_time_limited_mode`.
Calls Thermostat to disable `time_limited` and go back to previous target temperature mode. When thermostat is not in `time_limited` mode, it will do nothing.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.ThermostatOutputGr.description:
Command: `enable`.
Calls Thermostat Output Group to enable control.
Body is ignored.

Command: `disable`.
Calls Thermostat Output Group to disable control.
Body is ignored.

Command: `set_propagation_delay`.
Calls Thermostat Output Group to set propagation delay to the desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `set_antistop_enabled`.
Calls Thermostat Output Group to enable/disable antistop function.
Body is required.

Command: `set_antistop_work_time`.
Calls Thermostat Output Group to set antistop work time to desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `set_antistop_pause_time`.
Calls Thermostat Output Group to set antistop pause time to desired value.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.RelayIntegrator.Tu.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls RelayIntegrator to turn on output.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_off`.
Calls RelayIntegrator to turn off output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.RelayIntegrator.To.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls RelayIntegrator to toggle output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.BlindControllerInt.description:
Command: `open`.
Calls Blind Controller Integrator to open to the desired value.
Body is required.
Command is optional. Available when: check if `percent_opening_control` label is provided.

Command: `up`.
Calls Blind Controller Integrator to fully open blinds.
Body is ignored.
Command is optional. Available when: check if `percent_opening_control` label is provided.

Command: `down`.
Calls Blind Controller Integrator to fully close blinds.
Body is ignored.
Command is optional. Available when: check if `percent_opening_control` label is provided.

Command: `stop`.
Calls Blind Controller Integrator to request stop on every associated blind.
Body is ignored.

Command: `tilt`.
Calls Blind Controller Integrator to tilt to the desired value.
Body is required.
Command is optional. Available when: check if `percent_tilt_control` label is provided.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.DimmerRgbIntegrato.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls Dimmer RGB Integrator to turn on dimmers and rgb controllers.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_off`.
Calls Dimmer RGB Integrator to turn off dimmers and rgb controllers.
Body is ignored.

Command: `toggle`.
Calls Dimmer RGB Integrator to toggle dimmers and rgb controllers.
Body is ignored.

Command: `set_brightness`.
Calls Dimmer RGB Integrator to set brightness of dimmers and rgb controllers.
Body is required.

set_brightness.description: Array of two values: target brightness and transition time in ms. Second one is optional.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.DimmerRgbIntegrato.description:
Command: `set_color`.
Calls Dimmer RGB Integrator to set color rgb controllers.
Body is required.

set_color.description: Array of two values: color and transition time in ms. Second one is optional.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.DimmerRgbIntegrato.description:
Command: `set_temperature`.
Calls Dimmer RGB Integrator to set temperature of rgb controllers.
Body is required.

set_temperature.description: Array of two values: temperature and transition time in ms. Second one is optional.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.HeatPumpManager.En.description:
Command: `enable`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to enable control.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.HeatPumpManager.Di.description:
Command: `disable`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to disable control.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.HeatPumpManager.To.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to toggle control.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.HeatPumpManager.Se.description:
Command: `set_heating_target_temperature`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change `heating` work mode target temperature to the desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `set_cooling_target_temperature`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change `cooling` work mode target temperature to the desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `set_automatic_target_temperature`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change `automatic` work mode target temperature to the desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `set_dhw_target_temperature`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change DHW control target temperature to the desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `set_work_mode`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change mode to `heating`, `cooling`, `automatic` or `fireplace`.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.HeatPumpManager.En.description:
Command: `enable_schedule`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change target temperature mode to `schedule`. Available when manager has label `has_schedule`.`
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.HeatPumpManager.Di.description:
Command: `disable_schedule`.
Calls Heat Pump Manager to change target temperature mode to `constant`. Available when manager has label `has_schedule`.`
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Gate.FullMove.description:
Command: `full_move`.
Commands the gate controller to do the full move action.
Should be used when no `close_status_sensor` is associated or you want to just do the counter direction move according to current `state`.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Gate.PartialMove.description:
Command: `partial_move`.
Commands the gate controller to do the partial move action.
Should be used when no `close_status_sensor` is associated or you want to just do the counter direction move according to current `state`.
**NOTE**: This command requires the `partial_open_close_output` to be associated!
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Gate.FullOpen.description:
Command: `full_open`.
Commands the gate controller to do the full open action.
**NOTE**: This command requires the `close_status_sensor` to be associated!
**NOTE**: The command is accepted only if: the gate is in `closed` state or the gate is in `open` state while the `stopped_state` is `closing`, otherwise is ignored (returns not modified status).
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Gate.PartialOpen.description:
Command: `partial_open`.
Commands the gate controller to do the partial open action.
**NOTE**: This command requires the `close_status_sensor` and `partial_open_close_output` to be associated!
**NOTE**: The command is accepted only if: the gate is in `closed` state, otherwise is ignored (returns not modified status).
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Gate.Close.description:
Command: `close`.
Commands the gate controller to do the close action.
**NOTE**: This command requires the `close_status_sensor` to be associated!
**NOTE**: The command is accepted only if: the gate is in `open` state without `stopped_state` being `closing`, otherwise is ignored (returns not modified status).
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Gate.Stop.description:
Command: `stop`.
Commands the gate controller to stop current move action.
**NOTE**: The command is accepted only if: the gate is in `moving`, `closing` or `opening` state, otherwise is ignored (returns not modified status).
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Wicket.Unlock.description:
Command: `unlock`.
Unlocks (turns on) electric strike if its already locked.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.VIRTUAL.Wicket.Lock.description:
Command: `lock`.
Locks (turns off) electric strike if its already unlocked.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.IrRemote.Send.description:
Command: `send`.
Calls device to send the IR frame.
Body is required. Parameter: Hex string in broadlink format, max 2048 charactes, matching regex: `^[a-fA-F0-9]+$`.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.IrRemote.Lear.description:
Command: `learn`.
Calls device to start learning IR frame.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.RfRemote.Send.description:
Command: `send`.
Calls device to send the Rf frame.
Body is required. Parameter: Hex string in broadlink format, max 2048 charactes, matching regex: `^[a-fA-F0-9]+$`.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.RfRemote.Lear.description:
Command: `learn`.
Calls device to start learning RF frame.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.ModbusTransce.description:
Command: `enable_slave`.
Turn on modbus slave mode for transceiver.
Available when label `modbus_slave_support` provided.
Body is required.

baud_rate.description: Baud rate on which the slave device works.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.ModbusTransce.description:
Command: `disable_slave`.
Turn off modbus slave mode for transceiver, returns to standard modbus master mode.
Available when label `modbus_slave_support` provided.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.ModbusExtende.description:
Command: `enable_slave`.
Turn on modbus slave mode for extender.
Available when label `modbus_slave_support` provided.
Body is required.

baud_rate.description: Baud rate on which the slave device works.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.ModbusExtende.description:
Command: `disable_slave`.
Turn off modbus slave mode for extender, returns to standard modbus master mode.
Available when label `modbus_slave_support` provided.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.SystemModule.AnyTransceive.description:
Command: `enable_diagnostic`.
Turn on diagnostic mode for transceiver or extender.
Available when label `diagnostic_support` provided.
Body is ignored.

Command: `disable_diagnostic`.
Turn off diagnostic mode for transceiver or extender.
Available when label `diagnostic_support` provided.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.AlarmSystem.TwoStateOutput.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls device to turn on output.
Body is required. Parameter: Pin code to turn on output. Pin code can be 4 to 8 characters long and consists only of decimal numbers 0-9.
**NOTE**: Cannot be executed when output is managed by alarm central (output function is not 24, 25 or 64-79). You can check if your device contains `managed_by_alarm_central` label.

turn_on.description: Pin code to turn on output.

DeviceCommand.AlarmSystem.TwoStateOutput.description:
Command: `turn_off`.
Calls device to turn off output.
Body is required. Parameter: Pin code to turn off output. Pin code can be 4 to 8 characters long and consists only of decimal numbers 0-9.
**NOTE**: Cannot be executed when output is managed by alarm central (output function is not 24, 25 or 64-79). You can check if your device contains `managed_by_alarm_central` label.

turn_off.description: Pin code to turn off output.

DeviceCommand.AlarmSystem.TwoStateOutput.description:
Command: `toggle`.
Calls device to toggle output.
Body is required. Parameter: Pin code to change output state. Pin code can be 4 to 8 characters long and consists only of decimal numbers 0-9.
**NOTE**: Cannot be executed when output is managed by alarm central (output function is not 24, 25 or 64-79). You can check if your device contains `managed_by_alarm_central` label.

DeviceCommand.AlarmSystem.SatelAlarmZone.description:
Command: `arm`.
Calls zone to arm.
Body is required. Parameter: Pin code to arm zone Pin code can be 4 to 8 characters long and consists only of decimal numbers 0-9..

Command: `arm_in_mode`.
Calls zone to arm.
Body is required. Parameters:
`pin_code`: Pin code to arm zone. Pin code can be 4 to 8 characters long and consists only of decimal numbers 0-9.
`mode`: Mode which will be used to arm zone (0-3). For more information see Satel documentation.

mode.description: Mode which will be used to arm zone (0-3). For more information see Satel documentation.

DeviceCommand.AlarmSystem.SatelAlarmZone.description:
Command: `disarm`.
Calls zone to disarm.
Body is required. Parameter: Pin code to arm zone. Pin code can be 4 to 8 characters long and consists only of decimal numbers 0-9.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.EcoAirHeatPump.Rese.description:
Command: `reset_alarms`.
Sends request to heat pump device to reset alarms.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.EcoGeoHeatPump.Rese.description:
Command: `reset_alarms`.
Sends request to heat pump device to reset alarms.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.RemehaElgaACEHeatPu.description:
Command: `reset_alarms`.
Sends request to heat pump device to reset alarms.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxX1Battery.Char.description:
Command: `charge`.
Calls battery to charge during given period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 10000 (10W), maximum value from `maximum_charge_power` parameter), second is `duration_time` in seconds.

charge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxX1Battery.Disc.description:
Command: `discharge`.
Calls battery to discharge during given period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 10000 (10W), maximum value from `maximum_discharge_power` parameter), second is `duration_time` in seconds.

discharge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxX3Battery.Char.description:
Command: `charge`.
Calls battery to charge during given period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 10000 (10W), maximum value from `maximum_charge_power` parameter), second is `duration_time` in seconds.

charge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxX3Battery.Disc.description:
Command: `discharge`.
Calls battery to discharge during given period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 10000 (10W), maximum value from `maximum_discharge_power` parameter), second is `duration_time` in seconds.

discharge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GoodWeMtSmtInverter.description:
Command: `limit_active_power`.
Sends request to limit current active power of inverter.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in %.
**NOTE:**Requires `power_control_enabled` set to true.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GoodWeSdtMsDnsXsInv.description:
Command: `limit_active_power`.
Sends request to limit current active power of inverter.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in %.
**NOTE:**Requires `power_control_enabled` set to true.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HuaweiSUN2000Invert.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Turn on the inverter: set power limit to 100%.
Body is ignored.
**NOTE:**Command available when device has label `power_control_support`.

Command: `turn_off`.
Turn off the inverter: set power limit to 0%.
Body is ignored.
**NOTE:**Command available when device has label `power_control_support`.

Command: `limit_active_power`.
Sends request to limit current active power of inverter.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in %.
**NOTE:**Command available when device has label `power_control_support`.

Command: `set_power_control_mode`.
Sends request to change power control mode of inverter.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in %.
**NOTE:**Command available when device has label `power_control_mode_support`.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.AlphaInnotecHeatPum.description:
Command: `reset_alarms`.
Sends request to heat pump device to reset alarms.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.AmpowrAmpiHomeInver.description:
Command: `limit_active_power`.
Sends request to limit current active power of inverter.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in %.
**NOTE:**Requires `power_control_enabled` set to true.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompHCEV01CarCh.description:
Command: `set_current_limit`.
Sends request to limit charging current.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in A, multiplied by 1000 (mA). (range: 0-32000)

Command: `set_postpone_time`.
Sends request to postpone charging.
Body is required.
Parameter is time in hours. (range: 0-15).

Command: `set_charge_time_left`.
Sends request to limit charging time.
Body is required.
Parameter is time in hours. (range: 0-15).

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaHeatPump.description:
Command: `set_work_mode`.
Change work mode for heat pump.
Body is required.
Parameter is work mode, one of following: `cooling`, `heating`, `automatic`.

Command: `set_fixed_target_temperature`.
Change fixed target temperature for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Target temperature in Celsius.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaHeatPump.description:
Command: `set_heat_demand`.
Set heat demand for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Heat demand value.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaHeatPump.description:
Command: `set_cool_demand`.
Set cool demand for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Cool demand value.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaHeatPump.description:
Command: `set_heat_curve`.
Set requested heat curve for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Heat curve value.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaHeatPump.description:
Command: `set_heat_curve_enabled`.
Enable/Disable heat curve mode for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Enable/Disable heat curve mode.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaHeatPump.description:
Command: `set_electric_heater_active`.
Enable/Disable electric heater in heat pump.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.GalmetPrimaMainDhw..description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Change target temperature for DHW.
Body is required.

Command: `set_circulation_pump_enabled`.

Body is required.

Body is required.
Parameter is work mode, one of following: `cooling`, `heating`, `automatic`.

Command: `set_fixed_target_temperature`.
Change fixed target temperature for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Target temperature in Celsius.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.KaisaiKHCHeatPump.S.description:
Command: `set_heat_demand`.
Set heat demand for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Heat demand value.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.KaisaiKHCHeatPump.S.description:
Command: `set_cool_demand`.
Set cool demand for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Cool demand value.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.KaisaiKHCHeatPump.S.description:

Set requested heat curve for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Heat curve value.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.KaisaiKHCHeatPump.S.description:
Command: `set_heat_curve_enabled`.
Enable/Disable heat curve mode for requested zone in heat pump.
Body is required.

value.description: Enable/Disable heat curve mode.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.KaisaiKHCHeatPump.S.description:
Command: `set_electric_heater_active`.
Enable/Disable electric heater in heat pump.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.KaisaiKHCMainDhw.Se.description:
Command: `set_target_temperature`.
Change target temperature for DHW.
Body is required.

Command: `set_circulation_pump_enabled`.
Enable/Disable cirulation pump for DHW.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolarEdgeInverter.T.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Turn on the inverter - set active power limit to 100%.
Body is ignored.
**NOTE:** It is allowed to change only when `advanced_power_control_enabled` is set to `true` and `reactive_power_config` to `rrcr` and device has label `power_control_support`.

Command: `turn_off`.
Turn off the inverter - set active power limit to 0%.
Body is ignored.
**NOTE:** It is allowed to change only when `advanced_power_control_enabled` is set to `true` and `reactive_power_config` to `rrcr` and device has label `power_control_support`.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolisInverter.TurnO.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Turn on the inverter - set active power limit to 100%.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_off`.
Turn off the inverter - set active power limit to 0%.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxInverter.TurnO.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Turn on the inverter - set active power limit to 100%.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_off`.
Turn off the inverter - set active power limit to 0%.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.MitsubishiEcodanHea.description:
Command: `set_zone_target_temperature`.
Changes `target_temperature` parameter for requested zone.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.AmpowrAmpihomeBatte.description:
Command: `charge`.
Sends request to force charge the battery.
Body is ignored. **NOTE** Can only be changed when `inverter_working_mode` is `peak_shift`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

Command: `discharge`.
Sends request to force discharge the battery.
Body is ignored. **NOTE** Can only be changed when `inverter_working_mode` is `peak_shift`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

Command: `stop_forced_state`.
Sends request to stop any forced state of the battery.
Body is ignored. **NOTE** Can only be changed when `inverter_working_mode` is `peak_shift`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

Command: `stop`.
Sends request to stop any forced state of the battery.
Body is ignored. **NOTE** Can only be changed when `inverter_working_mode` is `peak_shift`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompHCEV01.Star.description:
Command: `start_charge`.
Sends request to car charger to start charge.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompHCEV01.Stop.description:
Command: `stop_charge`.
Sends request to car charger to stop charge.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.RemehaElgaACEHeatPu.description:
Command: `enable_smart_grid`.
Sends request to heat pump device to enable smart grid work mode. Adds the label `smart_grid_support`.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompBattery.Set.description:
Command: `set_charge_current_limit`.
Calls battery to set charging current limit.
Body is required.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompBattery.Cha.description:
Command: `charge`.
Calls battery to charge with given power.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 0 (0W), maximum is 65535000 (65535W)).
**NOTE** Can only be changed when `charge_work_mode` is `manual`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompBattery.Dis.description:
Command: `discharge`.
Calls battery to discharge with given power.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 0 (0W), maximum is 65535000 (65535W)).
**NOTE** Can only be changed when `charge_work_mode` is `manual`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HeatcompBattery.Sto.description:
Command: `stop`.
Stops the forced charging/discharging of the device.
Body is ignored. **NOTE** Can only be changed when `charge_work_mode` is `manual`. Device has label `battery_charge_support` when available.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HuaweiSUN2000Batter.description:
Command: `charge`.
Calls battery to charge during given period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 10000 (10W), maximum value from `maximum_charging_power` parameter), second is `duration_time` in seconds, maximum 86400. **NOTE** Available when device has label `battery_charge_support`

charge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HuaweiSUN2000Batter.description:
Command: `discharge`.
Calls battery to discharge during given period of time.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 10000 (10W), maximum value from `maximum_discharging_power` parameter), second is `duration_time` in seconds, maximum 86400. **NOTE** Available when device has label `battery_charge_support`

discharge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.HuaweiSUN2000Batter.description:
Command: `stop`.
Stops the forced charging/discharging of the device.
Body is ignored. **NOTE** Available when device has label `battery_charge_support`.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxX1Battery.Stop.description:
Command: `stop`.
Disables the remote control of battery.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.Modbus.SolaxX3Battery.Stop.description:
Command: `stop`.
Disables the remote control of battery.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.RGBCont.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Calls RGBController to turn on output.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_off`.
Calls RGBController to turn off output.
Body is ignored.

Command: `toggle`.
Calls RGBController to toggle output.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.Inverte.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Turn on the inverter - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_off`.
Turn off the inverter - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

Command: `limit_active_power`.
Sends request to limit current active power of inverter - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is required.
Parameter is limit in user defined unit, depending on implementation.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.BlindCo.description:
Command: `stop`.
Calls Blind Controller to stop immediately at current position - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

Command: `calibration`.
Calls Blind Controller to start calibration cycle - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.Radiato.description:
Command: `open`.
Calls Radiator Actuator to open to the desired value.
Body is required.

Command: `calibration`.
Calls Radiator Actuator to calibrate - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.SmokeSe.description:
Command: `test`.
Starts self-test of device - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

Command: `reset`.
Resets current device alarms - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.Battery.description:
Command: `charge`.
Calls battery to charge during given period of time - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 0 (0W), maximum is 50000000 (50000W)), second is `duration_time` in seconds, maximum 86400. **NOTE** Available when device has label `battery_charge_support`

charge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.Battery.description:
Command: `discharge`.
Calls battery to discharge during given period of time - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is required.
First parameter is `active_power` in mW (minimum is 0 (0W), maximum is 50000000 (50000W)), second is `duration_time` in seconds, maximum 86400. **NOTE** Available when device has label `battery_charge_support`

discharge.description: Array of two values: active power and duration time.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.Battery.description:
Command: `stop`.
Stops the forced charging/discharging of the device. - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.CarChar.description:
Command: `start_charge`.
Calls car charger to start chargin the EV - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is optional.
Parameter is `charge_power` in mW (minimum is 0 (0W), maximum is 350000000 (350kW))

Command: `stop_charge`.
Stops charging of the EV. - performs a command callback call in containing custom device.
Body is ignored.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.AirCond.description:
Command: `turn_on`.
Turn on the air conditioner.
Body is ignored.

Command: `turn_on`.
Turn off the air conditioner.
Body is ignored.

Command: `set_mode`.
Changes mode of air conditioner.
Body is required.

Command: `set_fan_speed`.
Changes fan speed of air conditioner.
Body is required.

set_fan_speed.description:
Air conditioner fan speed.
Possible values in `available_fan_speeds`.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.AirCond.description:
Command: `set_horizontal_swing`.
Changes horizontal swing of air conditioner.
Body is required.

set_horizontal_swing.description:
Air conditioner horizontal swing.
Possible values in `horizontal_swing_available_states`.

DeviceCommand.CustomDeviceModule.AirCond.description:
Command: `set_vertical_swing`.
Changes vertical swing of air conditioner.
Body is required.

set_vertical_swing.description:
Air conditioner vertical swing.
Possible values in `vertical_swing_available_states`.

ParentCommand.Common.SetColor.description:
Command: `set_color`.
Set provided widget color for all devices in parent device.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Ass.description:
Command: `assign_button`.
Add momentary button to specified page if button available.
Body is required.

Command: `assign_button`.
Add bistable button to specified page if button available.
Body is required.

output.description: Output to be assigned to button.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Add.description:
Command: `add_page`.
Add page with specified id to `page_order`.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Rem.description:
Command: `remove_page`.
Remove page with specified id from `page_order`.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Set.description:
Command: `set_page_order`.
Sets page_order specified in parameter.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Ena.description:
Command: `enable_quick_page`.
Sets page with specified id as `quick_page`.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Dis.description:
Command: `disable_quick_page`.
Remove quick_page. Sets null to `quick_page`.
Body is ignored.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Add.description:
Command: `add_quick_page_button`.
Add button with specified id to quick page buttons. Button must be added to other regular page.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Rem.description:
Command: `remove_page_button`.
Remove button from page. When button is removed from regular page and the same button is added to quick page it is removed from quick page either. First parameter is `page_id`, second parameter is `button_id`.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Cle.description:
Command: `clean_page`.
Removes all buttons or widgets from page with specified id.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Set.description:
Command: `set_autolock_pin_code`.
Turn on autolock feature and set specified string as pin code.
Body is required.

set_autolock_pin_code.description: Pin code in string format. Example: `1234`

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Ass.description:
Command: `assign_sensor_widget`.
Add sensor widget to specified page, if sensor widget available. If sensor has more than one parameter that can be displayed user can specify `sensor_type` which indicates which sensor parameter will be sent to widget in control panel. Parameter `sensor_type` is optional.
Body is required.

sensor.description: Sensor to be assigned to widget.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Rem.description:
Command: `remove_page_sensor`.
Remove sensor widget from page.
Body is required.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Ass.description:
Command: `assign_page_thermostat`.
Assign thermostat to specified thermostat page. Page must exist in page order.
Body is required

thermostat.description: Thermostat to be assigned to widget.

ParentCommand.SBus.SceneControlPanel.Ass.description:
Command: `assign_alarm_zones`.
Replace alarm zones assigned to specified page, if alarm zone widgets available.
Body is required.

assign_alarm_zones.description: Alarm zone widget to be assigned.

alarm_zones.description: Alarm zones to be assigned to widget.

ParentCommand.SBus.ParentDeviceWithMbus..description:
Command: `rescan_mbus_master`.
Calls the device to rescan MBus master devices.
Body is ignored.

ParentCommand.AlarmSystem.Satel.ReadConf.description:
Command: `read_configuration`.
Calls parent device to read zones, intputs and outputs configuration from Satel central unit. Devices will be added to parent according to configuration or removed from parent if they no longer exist in central unit.
**NOTE:** This may take a while (about 3 minutes with good network connection). Event `device_configuration_read_finished` will be send to websocket when read is finished.

SceneCommand.Activate.description:
Command: `activate`.
Calls Blind Controller to open to the desired value.
Body is ignored.

SceneCommand.EnableLiveLog.description:
Command: `enable_live_log`.
Enable send live log from scene
Body is ignored.

SceneCommand.DisableLiveLog.description:
Command: `disable_live_log`.
Disable send live log from scene
Body is ignored.

SceneCommand.EnqueueAction.description:
Command: `enqueue_action`.
Schedules the action to execute for scene after a period of time.
Body is required.

type.description: Type of action to execute. Parameter change or command.

param_or_command.description: Name of parameter that will be changed or command that will be executed.

argument.description: Value that will be set in the parameter when action type is `parameter` or argument to execute command when action type is `command`. Type varies depending on the parameter or command.

after.description: Time in milliseconds after which the action should be executed.

SceneCommand.CancelAction.description:
Command: `cancel_action`.
Cancels the scheduled action of a scene.
Body is required.

SceneCommand.ClearActions.description:
Command: `clear_actions`.
Remove all scheduled actions for the scene.
Body is ignored.

AutomationCommand.EnableLiveLog.description:
Command: `enable_live_log`.
Enable send live log from automations
Body is ignored.

AutomationCommand.DisableLiveLog.description:
Command: `disable_live_log`.
Disable send live log from automations
Body is ignored.

AutomationCommand.EnqueueAction.description:
Command: `enqueue_action`.
Schedules the action to execute for automation after a period of time.
Body is required.

type.description: Type of action to execute. Parameter change or command.

param_or_command.description: Name of parameter that will be changed or command that will be executed.

argument.description: Value that will be set in the parameter when action type is `parameter` or argument to execute command when action type is `command`. Type varies depending on the parameter or command.

after.description: Time in milliseconds after which the action should be executed.

AutomationCommand.CancelAction.description:
Command: `cancel_action`.
Cancels the scheduled action of a automation.
Body is required.

AutomationCommand.ClearActions.description:
Command: `clear_actions`.
Remove all scheduled actions for the automation.
Body is ignored.

value.description:
Energy consumption/fed for the month.
Unit: kWh with three decimal numbers, multiplied by 1000 (Wh).

Water flow volume for the month.
Unit: m3 with two decimal numbers, multiplied by 100.

single_click_mode.description:
Enables single click mode. If enabled, only single click and hold actions will be reported, but it wont have report delay.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `single_click_mode_support` label is provided.

button_set.description:
Button sets info.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `single_click_mode_support` label is provided.

available_count.description: Available (configured as visible for user) count of button sets, cannot be larger than `total_count`.

current.description: Indicates button set that is currently selected.

target_opening.description:
Desired setpoint opening, which device will try to achieve.
Unit: %.
**NOTE:** If device doesnt contain `percent_opening_control` label, target opening is limited to 0%, 50% or 100% (only these three).

window_covering_type.description: Defines the type of window covering the controller is connected to. Depending on the value of this parameter, the controller behavior will change and some parameters may be unavailable. Can be modified with values from `allowed_window_covering_types` property.

allowed_window_covering_types.description: List of available window covering types supported by the controller. Allowed values to set in `window_covering_type` property.

lift_control_mode.description: Defines the control algorithm of lifting movement. Depending on the value of this parameter, the controller behavior will change and some parameters may be unavailable. Can be modified with values from `allowed_lift_control_modes` property.

allowed_lift_control_modes.description: List of available lift control modes supported by the controller. Allowed values to set in `lift_control_mode` property.

target_tilt.description:
Desired tilt position
Unit: %.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `percent_tilt_control` label is provided.

current_tilt.description:
Current tilt position
Unit: %.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `percent_tilt_control` label is provided.

tilt_range.description:
Determines tilt range.
Unit: angle(degrees).
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `percent_tilt_control` label is provided.
Can be modified when: check if `window_covering_type` is `tilt_blind` or `pergola`. When `window_covering_type` is `tilt_blind` ONLY 90 and 180 are valid values.

full_cycle_duration.description:
Time required by motor to do full lift cycle from 100% to 0% or 0% to 100% (select larger). Proper full open or full close action is based on this value.
Unit: seconds
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `has_lift_duration` label is provided.
Can be modified when: check if `lift_control_mode` is `fixed_duration`.

tilt_duration.description:
Time required by motor to do full tilt cycle.
Unit: milliseconds
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `has_tilt_duration` label is provided.

tilt_cycle_distance.description: Number of motor steps to do full tilt cycle. Available when: check if `has_tilt_cycle_distance` label is provided.

motor_running_current_threshold.description:
Current threshold that indicates motor is running.
Unit: mA.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `has_motor_running_current_threshold` label is provided.

backlight_mode.description: Buttons backlight mode. Parameter is optional. Available when backlight is supported - check if `has_backlight` label is provided.

backlight_brightness.description:
Buttons backlight brightness.
Paremeter hidden when backlight is unsupported.
Unit: %

backlight_idle_color.description:
HTML/Hex RGB representation of color when controller is in idle (inactive state).
Paremeter hidden when backlight is unsupported.

backlight_active_color.description:
HTML/Hex RGB representation of color when controller is active eg. motor is working.
Paremeter hidden when backlight is unsupported.

buttons_inverted.description:
Replace up and down buttons directions.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `button_inversion_support` label is provided.

outputs_inverted.description:
Replace up and down outputs directions.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `output_inversion_support` label is provided.

button_signal_type.description:
Selected button specific behavior. eg. impulse = on/off impulse is required to start action.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `percent_opening_control` label is *NOT* provided.

output_signal_type.description:
Selected output specific behavior. eg. impulse = on/off impulse is required to start motor.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `percent_opening_control` label is *NOT* provided.

ambient_light_intensity.description:
Measured ambient light intensity.
Unit: %.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `has_backlight_brightness_sensor` label is provided.

target_temperature.description:
Desired setpoint temperature, which device will try to achieve.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.
Minimum from parameter `target_temperature_minimum`, maximum from parameter `target_temperature_maximum`.

current.description:
Regulator target temperature mode. Specifies if regulator works in `constant` mode with one target temperature, `time_limited` mode with one temporary target temperature or according to schedule in `schedule` mode with many target temperatures in time, configured by user.
NOTE: Parameter is read only, use commands to change target temperature mode!
NOTE: Parameter cannot be `schedule` if thermostat doesnt have `has_schedule` label!
NOTE: When not associated with Virtual Thermostat it will always work in `constant` mode.

remaining_time.description:
Remaining time until `time_limited` mode ends. Cannot be modified directly - use commands.
Unit: minutes.

target_temperature_minimum.description:
Lower limit of the target temperature. Could not be greater than maximum. Setting minimum value above target value, will also change target value to minimum.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.

target_temperature_maximum.description:
Upper limit of the target temperature. Could not be less than minimum. Setting maximum below target, will also change target value to minimum.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.

target_temperature_reached.description: Controls device`s algorithm state indicator. eg LED Diode. May be controlled by external algorithms or devices such as Thermostat (when thermostat is active, indicator will blink)

confirm_time_mode.description: Mainly for Mobile/Web App purposes. Indicates if time mode modal should be displayed when changing thermostat temperature. Controlled by Virtual Thermostat.

user_menu_lock.description: Pin code information to lock regulators user menu. Parameter is optional. Available when user menu lock is supported - check if `user_menu_lock_support` label is provided.

timeout.description:
Protection functionality, that will set device state to off if there are communication problems.
Unit: minutes.

timeout_enabled.description: Indicates that timeout functionality is enabled.

backlight_mode.description: Buttons backlight mode. Parameter is optional. Available when backlight is supported - check if `has_backlight` label is provided.

backlight_brightness.description:
Buttons backlight brightness.
Paremeter hidden when backlight is unsupported.
Unit: %

backlight_idle_color.description:
HTML/Hex RGB representation of color when controller is in idle (inactive state).
Paremeter hidden when backlight is unsupported.

backlight_active_color.description:
HTML/Hex RGB representation of color when controller is active eg. motor is working.
Paremeter hidden when backlight is unsupported.

inverted.description: Indicates if should invert physical state of relay compared to represented state in application.

time_since_state_change.description:
Time since last relay state change.
Unit: seconds

startup_state.description:
State of output that should be set on device after power restart. Parameter is optional. Available when function is supported - check if `relay_startup_state_support` label is provided.
*NOTE*: cannot be changed when `work_mode` is set to `alarm_siren`.

no_output_mode.description: Indicates that relay is in no output mode - it takes state update as usual but hardware output remains off. Parameter is optional. Available when function is supported - check if `no_output_mode_support` label is provided.

trigger_signal_type.description:
Selected device hardware trigger behavior. Impulse = (monostable trigger) impulse signal toggles the output state, state_change = (bistable trigger) when trigger state changes, output will be set equal to trigger signal.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `trigger_signal_config_support` label is provided.

allowed_trigger_signal_types.description:
List of available trigger signal types supported by the device. Allowed values to set in `trigger_signal_type` property.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `trigger_signal_config_support` label is provided.

ambient_light_intensity.description:
Measured ambient light intensity.
Unit: %.
Parameter is optional. Available when: check if `has_backlight_brightness_sensor` label is provided.

work_mode.description: Relay working mode.

opening_minimum.description:
Lower valve opening level. Could not be greater than maximum. Setting minimum value above current opening value, will also change current opening value to minimum.
Unit: %

opening_maximum.description:
Upper valve opening level. Could not be less than minimum. Setting maximum value below current opening value, will also change current opening value to maximum.
Unit: %

valve_temperature.description:
Measured valve temperature value.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.

Parameter is optional. Available when sensor is supported - check if `has_valve_temperature_sensor` label is provided.

emergency_opening.description:
Emergency opening level when communication with central device is lost.
Unit: %.

Parameter is optional. Check if `emergency_opening_support` label is provided.

temperature.description:
Measured temperature value.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.

calibration.description:
Static point temperature calibration, used to adjust measurments.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.
**NOTE:** Parameter will be **read-only** if label `factory_calibrated` is present!

humidity.description:
Measured relative humidity value.
Unit: rH% with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.

pressure.description:
Measured pressure value.
Unit: hPa with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.

altitude.description: Setting the altitude compensates the atmospheric pressure reading to the pressure at mean sea level, that is normally given in weather reports.

Device.WTP.IAQSensor.description: Wireless Indexed Air Quality Sensor representation.

iaq_accuracy.description: Index of Air Quality calculation accuracy

acknowledgment.description: Newer sensors support communication protocol with acknowledgment. When enabled, sensor will try deliver state change message three times or until ack is received. May increase battery usage if communication is noisy, but data transfer is more reliable.

enabled.description: Enable or disable sensor. eg. If you want sense only at night time, you can setup automation to enable/disable sensor.

blind_duration.description:
Duration of sensor being off after detecting motion.
Unit: seconds

pulses_threshold.description:
Sensitivity factor. How many pulses from sensor are needed to treat action as motion.
*NOTE*: available when `sensor_type` is set to `pir`, i.e. device `variant` is `generic`.

pulses_window.description:
Sensitivity factor. Maximum time window in which {pulses_treshold} must occur to treat action as motion.
Unit: seconds
*NOTE*: available when `sensor_type` is set to `pir`, i.e. device `variant` is `generic`.

motion_detected.description:
Holds latest motion detection state. Remains `true` on motion detection and `false` when `blind_duration` time elapses.
**Notice**: the value will remain `true`` all the time when subsequent motion detections occur until motion stops.

time_since_motion.description:
Time since last motion detected.
Unit: seconds
**Notice**: -1 means not detected so far (motion didnt happen since system start).
**Notice**: This value will show 0 for each detected move, even if the previous one has not yet finished.

pm1p0.description:
Measured concentration of PM1.0 value (particulate matter).
Unit: g/m3.

pm2p5.description:
Measured concentration of PM2.5 value (particulate matter).
Unit: g/m3.

target_temperature.description:
Current target temperature. Modification will result in change of `constant` or `time_limited` target temperature to the desired value. If thermostat works in `time_limited` mode it will change target temperature only, not affecting `remaining_time`. If thermostat works in `schedule` mode it will change target temperature mode to `constant`.
Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.
Minimum from parameter `target_temperature_minimum`, maximum from parameter `target_temperature_maximum`.

current.description:
Thermostat target temperature mode. Specifies if thermostat is working in `constant` mode with one target temperature, `time_limited` mode with one temporary target temperature or according to schedule in `schedule` mode with many target temperatures in time, configured by user.
NOTE: Parameter is read only, use commands to change target temperature mode!
NOTE: Parameter cannot be `schedule` if thermostat doesnt have `has_schedule` label!

Remaining time until `time_limited` mode ends. Cannot be modified directly - use commands.
Unit: minutes.

Unit: C with one decimal number, multiplied by 10.
